channel.title: jMock News
channel.description: jMock is a lightweight mock object testing library for Java.

item.title: Mock Roles, Not Objects
item.description: The paper presented at OOSPA'04 is now available online.
item.xhtml:div: The paper, Mock Roles Not Objects presented at OOSPA'04 is now available online.

item.title: Continuous Integration Running Again
item.description: The DamageControl continuous integration server has been fixed and is building jMock again.
item.xhtml:div: The DamageControl continuous integration server has been fixed and is building jMock again. This means that the website and news are up to date and new snapshots are available.

item.title: Testing Multithreaded Code
item.description: A new article describing how to use jMock to test multithreaded code.
item.xhtml:div: A new article describing how to use jMock to test multithreaded code.

item.title: jMock at OOPSLA
item.description: jMock will be presented and demonstrated at OOPSLA'04, October 24-28, Vancouver.
item.xhtml:div: OOPSLA'04 will contain two jMock sessions, a presentation entitled Mock Roles not Objects & a live demonstration.

item.title: FishEye for the Mock Guy
item.description: We now use FishEye to expose the jMock CVS repository over the web.
item.xhtml:div: We now use FishEye to expose the CVS repository via the web. A great feature is an RSS feed of CVS commits, so you can be informed about new features as we check them in.

item.title: See jMock in Action at the ADC
item.description: jMock will be used in the Top-Down TDD using Mock Objects and Inversion of Control tutorial run by Manish Shah and Damian Guy at the Agile Development Conference.
item.xhtml:div: jMock will be used in the Top-Down TDD using Mock Objects and Inversion of Control tutorial run by Manish Shah and Damian Guy at the Agile Development Conference.

item.title: jMock 1.0.1 Released
item.description: Released jMock 1.0.1, which fixes and improves the generation of error messages.
item.xhtml:div: Released jMock 1.0.1, which fixes and improves the generation of error messages.

item.title: EasyMock Comparison
item.description: Added an article comparing jMock and EasyMock.
item.xhtml:div: Added an article comparing jMock and EasyMock.

item.title: Print Media Support
item.description: Added style sheets for print media. Articles on this site are now easier to read when printed on paper.
item.xhtml:div: Added style sheets for print media. Articles on this site are now easier to read when printed on paper.

item.title: jMock 1.0.0 Released
item.description: Version 1.0.0 has been released. Download it now.
item.xhtml:div: Version 1.0.0 has been released. Download it now.

item.title: Custom Stubs
item.description: A new tutorial has been uploaded, showing how to write custom stubs.
item.xhtml:div: A new tutorial has been uploaded, showing how to write custom stubs.

item.title: Binary Snapshots
item.description: Binary snapshots are now being built by the continuous integration process.
item.xhtml:div: New! Binary snapshots are now being built by the continuous integration process. Get them while they're hot if you want to look cool!

item.title: Continuous Integration is Running Again
item.description: After some downtime while we moved the project hosting onto a new server, the continuous integration process is now building snapshots and updating the website again.
item.xhtml:div: After some downtime while we moved the project hosting onto a new server, the continuous integration process is now building snapshots and updating the website again.

item.title: Yoga for your Unit Tests
item.description: A new article, Yoga for your Unit Tests, describes how to use jMock to avoid brittle tests.
item.xhtml:div: A new article, Yoga for your Unit Tests, describes how to use jMock to avoid brittle tests.

item.title: DynaMock Comparison
item.description: A new article, Comparing jMock and Dynamock, explains the difference between jMock and the DynaMock API of mockobjects.com.
item.xhtml:div: A new article, Comparing jMock and Dynamock, explains the difference between jMock and the DynaMock API of mockobjects.com.

item.title: Mocking Concrete Classes
item.description: CGLIB support has been committed to CVS.
item.xhtml:div: CGLIB support has recently been committed to CVS. This optional extension will allow you to mock concrete classes, helpful if you have to work with awkward and/or legacy code.

item.title: Source Snapshots
item.description: The continuous integration system now creates snapshots whenever anything is committed to CVS.
item.xhtml:div: Source snapshots are now available for download. Snapshots are created by the continuous integration system whenever anything is committed to the CVS repository.
